alert.note: Alert for Upshur (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 5:42PM EDT until May 08 at 4:31AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in West Virginia... Buckhannon River Near Buckhannon affecting Upshur County. For the Tygart Valley River...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Buckhannon River Near Buckhannon. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, Several streets, homes, and businesses along the river flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:45 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 24.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:45 PM EDT Saturday was 24.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 24.5 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 23.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 24.2 feet on 03/02/1997. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rlx. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM EDT.
